intro: Oenothera canovirens, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Oenothera canovirens is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its ecological importance as a nectar source for nocturnal pollinators.
